title: Snow Covered Alley
medium: graphite, watercolor, and gouache on paper mounted on cardboard
credit_line: Bequest of Mr. and Mrs. James H. Beal
provenance_text:
Charles E. Burchfield [1893-1967], West Seneca, NY; Frank K. M. Rehn, Inc., New York, NY, until November 14, 1945 [1]; Mr. [1898-1987] and Mrs. James H. Beal (born Rebecca Huebley Jones) [1898-1993], Pittsburgh, PA, November 14, 1945 until February 14, 1987; Mrs. James H. Beal, Pittsburgh, PA, until April 23, 1993; bequest of Mr. and Mrs. James H. Beal to Carnegie Museum of Art, Pittsburgh, PA, February 1994.

Notes:
[1]. Mrs. Beal purchased the watercolor for $150 from the Rehn Gallery in November 1945 (see copies of correspondence with the gallery, including copy of the receipt for the purchase, dated November 14, 1945, from Archives of American Art, in curatorial file.) See also "The Beal Collection of American Art," Carnegie Museum of Art, 1994, p. 73.

creator.death_place: West Seneca (Erie county, New York state, United States)
